description: This chapter focuses on Paul's introduction to the Corinthian church, addressing themes of unity and wisdom.

questions.question: How was Paul called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus?
How does Paul address the church of God in Corinth?
What blessing does Paul pronounce upon the Corinthians?
options: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
May you be healthy and successful in life

questions.question: What does Paul always thank God for regarding the Corinthians?
options: For the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus

questions.question: In what ways were the Corinthians enriched in Christ?
options: In all speech and all knowledge

questions.question: What did the Christians not lack while waiting for the revelation of Jesus Christ?
How will believers be presented on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ?
To what has God called you?
options: To fellowship with His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord

questions.question: How does Paul urge the Corinthians to live?
options: That all of you worship God
That all of you agree with one another and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly united in mind and thought
That you all love one another
That you all remain in meditation

questions.question: What was the sign of divisions in the Corinthian church?
options: One says, 'I follow Paul,' another, 'I follow Apollos,' another, 'I follow Cephas,' still another, 'I follow Christ'

questions.question: What question does Paul ask the Corinthians?
What was Christ's purpose in sending Paul?
options: Not to baptize but to preach the gospel

questions.question: How does the message of the cross appear to those who are perishing?
What is the foolishness of God wiser than?
What has Christ Jesus become for us from God?
How was God's testimony about Christ confirmed in the Corinthians?
From whom did Paul learn about the divisions among the Corinthians?
Whom did Paul baptize in the Corinthian church?
Why did Paul baptize so few people?
options: Because others had the gift of baptizing
So no one can say that you were baptized in my name
Because others refused to be baptized

questions.question: Who else did Paul baptize?
Where is it written: "I will destroy the wisdom of the wise; the intelligence of the intelligent I will frustrate"?
How has God treated the wisdom of this world?
What did the world fail to know through its wisdom?
What did Jews demand to accept Christ?
How did preaching Christ crucified appear to the Jews?
To those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, what is Christ?
options: The power of God and the wisdom of God

questions.question: How many in the church were wise by human standards when God called them?
What did God choose to shame the wise?
options: The foolish things of the world

questions.question: What did God choose to nullify the things that are?
Why did God act this way?
options: So that no one may boast before him

questions.question: How should the one who boasts, boast?
Who wrote to the Corinthians along with Paul?
Whose name do the Corinthians call on?
options: The name of our Lord Jesus Christ

questions.question: In what ways were the Corinthians made complete in Christ Jesus?
options: In all speech and all knowledge
In all preaching and all wisdom
In all strength and all power
In all love and all patience

questions.question: By whose name does Paul appeal to the Corinthians?
options: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ
In the name of the Holy Spirit
In the name of the apostles

questions.question: How was Paul sent to preach the gospel so that the cross would not be emptied of its power?
Who does Paul ask about in his writing regarding the world?
options: The wise, the scholar, the philosopher of this age

questions.question: What is God's weakness stronger than?
How many in the called Corinthian church were of noble birth?
What did God choose to shame the strong?
options: The weak things of the world
